life_contexts.value: enjoying a stable routine and work-life balance
planning a vacation or trip they're excited about
juggling childcare and a full-time job
saving up for a down payment on a house
living paycheck to paycheck
trying to eat healthier and exercise more
dealing with burnout from their demanding job
building a side hustle or creative project
trying to pay off significant student loan debt
recently moved to a new city and exploring
managing a chronic illness or mental health condition
caring for an aging or sick parent
planning their upcoming wedding
enjoying retirement and pursuing hobbies
working a second job to make ends meet
starting a new job in a different field
feeling lonely and trying to make new friends
volunteering for a cause they are passionate about
dealing with a toxic boss or work environment
celebrating a recent promotion or achievement
learning new skills through online courses
renovating their home or apartment
navigating a recent breakup or divorce
facing potential layoffs or job insecurity
training for a major athletic event like a marathon
going back to school for another degree or certification
trying to get a small business or startup off the ground
navigating co-parenting with an ex-partner
learning a new language or musical instrument
dealing with teenage children and their drama
house hunting in a competitive market
going through a mid-life crisis and questioning their choices
coping with an empty nest after their kids left for college
recovering from a serious accident or surgery
raising a child with special needs
dealing with the legal system over a dispute
newly sober and navigating recovery
exploring their gender identity or sexuality
writing a novel in their spare time
caring for pets with medical issues
dealing with identity theft or financial fraud
handling a sudden and unexpected financial windfall
in the middle of a messy inheritance dispute
involved in a niche, competitive hobby (e.g., dog shows, e-sports)

chatting_quirks.value: Uses perfect grammar and punctuation, like a style guide.
Heavy use of emojis to convey tone (both common and obscure).
all lowercase, minimal punctuation, very casual.
Uses a lot of current internet slang and acronyms (iykyk, fr, ngl).
Sends short, clipped, one-to-three-word replies.
Is a 'double-texter,' sending multiple short messages in a row.
Never asks questions back; talks about themself but shows little curiosity in others.
Primarily 'reacts' to messages (with a heart, thumbs up, etc.) instead of replying with words.
Writes in long, reflective paragraphs, even for simple questions.
Abuses ellipses... to create pauses... and add drama...
Always has to have the last word, even if it's just 'lol' or a thumbs-up emoji.
Loves to use dad jokes and bad puns at every opportunity.
Responds instantly, no matter the time of day or night.
Ends short messages with a period, making them seem passive-aggressive or stern (e.g., 'Okay.', 'Sounds good.').
Narrates their day with a stream of photos (food, pets, scenery) instead of text.
Communicates primarily through reaction GIFs and memes.
USES ALL CAPS WHEN EXCITED OR ANGRY.
Ends every message with a formal or friendly sign-off ('Best,', 'Cheers,', 'xoxo').
Uses 'therapy speak' in casual conversation (e.g., 'holding space,' 'emotional bandwidth,' 'that's not serving me').
Immediately offers unsolicited advice or tries to 'fix' any problem mentioned.
Takes days to reply, but apologizes profusely when they do.
Uses italics or tildes for emphasis and tone.
Immediately follows up a sent message with a correction using an asterisk (e.g., 'See you their' -> '*there').
Asks a relentless stream of questions, making conversation feel like an interrogation.
*Responds to complex topics by sending links to articles or YouTube videos.
Uses outdated slang from 10-15 years ago (e.g., 'epic fail', 'totes').
Sends breathless, unpunctuated voice-to-text messages full of errors.
Sends long, rambling voice notes instead of texting.
Mixes in another language from their bilingual background.
Types out sound effects or actions instead of using emojis (e.g., sigh, facepalm, sips coffee).
*Uses corporate jargon in casual contexts (e.g., 'Let's circle back on that,' 'What's your bandwidth?').
Sends vague, attention-seeking messages to prompt a 'What's wrong?' response (e.g., 'Ugh, some days...').
Always uses proper capitalization but never any punctuation
Is a chronic oversharer, offering up TMI without prompting.
Uses excessive punctuation?!?! for emphasis!!!
*Uses hashtags unironically in normal texts (e.g., 'Just finished my run! #blessed').
A 'humblebragger' who disguises boasts as complaints (e.g., 'So tired, my flight from Paris was so long').
Writes in dense, academic prose with footnotes and asides.
Formats texts with poetic line breaks for rhythm.
Types with lots of typos but never corrects them
Uses old-school emoticons :) instead of emojis
Never uses contractions, resulting in a stilted, formal style.
Replies with nothing but a single, cryptic emoji.
Always types in complete sentences with proper structure
